dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4141 IH: To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to enter into enhanced-use leases for excess property of the National Cemetery Administration that is unsuitable for burial purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Crenshaw (for himself, Ms. Brown of Florida, Mr. DeSantis, Mr. Yoho, and Mr. Mica) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to enter into enhanced-use leases for excess property of the National Cemetery Administration that is unsuitable for burial purposes.

section.header: Authority of Secretary of Veterans Affairs to enter into enhanced-use leases for excess property of the National Cemetery Administration that is unsuitable for burial purposes

subsection.text: Section 8162(a)(2) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking only for the provision and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting only if the lease is not inconsistent with and will not adversely affect the mission of the Department for—; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraphs:

subparagraph.text: the provision of supportive housing; or
other purposes, only in the case of excess property of the National Cemetery Administration that is unsuitable for burial purposes.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to a lease entered into after the date of the enactment of this Act.
